page.title: 05LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content:
{VILLAGE HALL} The hall was built in 1919. It was used for community activities more in the past than now. Craigievar branch of the Scottish Women's Rural Institute meet monthly. Usually at these meetings a guest speaker or demonstrator of craft attends and craft or baking competitions take place by members.
{CRAIGIEVAR CASTLE} Visitors come from all over the world to visit Craigievar Castle, which is the seat of the Forbes family, and managed by the National Trust for Scotland. Members of the family still hold functions in the castle. The late Lord Sempill from Craigievar Castle donated land for the building of the Hall (above).
